intro: Trigonia rugosa, commonly known as the rough trigonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, five-petaled yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Trigonia rugosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
